#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Open a Trade School
#Text=Trade schools or vocational schools offer hands-on , practical training for professions that require a working knowledge of a particular field .
#Text=There are many different types of trade schools , ranging from esthetician and culinary schools to carpentry and auto repair schools .
#Text=If you 're an expert in a specific trade , and you enjoy sharing your knowledge , you may want to find out how to open a trade school .
#Text=It 's important to know that , in order to open a trade school , you 'll need a sound business plan as well as permission from your local and state government .
#Text=Planning the process properly is crucial to its success .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine which type of trade school you want to open .
#Text=Usually , you 'll want to open a school in your field of expertise so you can evaluate every aspect of the trade school 's function .
#Text=Investigate whether there 's a demand for this type of trade school in your area .
#Text=Find out if there 's any competition in the area and if that will hamper your startup plans .
#Text=Find out what trade certifications you need , such as welder 's , plumber 's or electrician 's certificate .
#Text=Draw up a business plan that can serve as a funding application to the state .
#Text=Explain the curriculum you plan to offer and the types of instructors you want to attract .
#Text=Define the demand for the school in the area by analyzing job statistics and educational statistics .
#Text=Describe the costs of starting up the school , including location , materials , educator contracts , insurance and taxes .
#Text=Outline your income projections for the first 2 years .
#Text=Register your trade school with the appropriate local and state organizations .
#Text=Raise the capital to open a trade school by getting a business loan from a bank or obtaining state or private funding .
#Text=Find a location for your trade school .
#Text=Make sure it 's easily accessible and offers the potential to adapt it to a safe learning environment .
#Text=Adapt the location for your trade school .
#Text=Remember to have it evaluated by your local fire department to determine whether it meets all safety requirements .
#Text=Get insurance for your trade school .
#Text=This includes insurance for the building and its contents , as well as liability insurance and any other type of insurance you deem necessary .
#Text=Purchase all necessary equipment .
#Text=The types of equipment will depend on the trade you 're teaching .
#Text=Draw up contracts for your staff as well as admission agreements for students .
#Text=Interview and hire educators .
#Text=Choose applicants who are qualified and experienced in the trade and in front of a class .
#Text=Install a security system with armed response to protect the school and everybody in it from crime , fire and other hazards .
#Text=Launch a marketing plan to attract pupils .
#Text=This can include advertising at schools , in newspapers , on billboards and on local television .
#Text=Enroll your students for the first year .
#Text=Open your trade school .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Always keep in contact with trade unions to stay abreast of the latest developments in your field .
#Text=Always consider creating a website that offers internship and job opportunities for students and alumni .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Trade certification or license
#Text=Business plan
#Text=Investment capital
#Text=State registration
#Text=Insurance
#Text=Equipment
#Text=Security system
